page.title: 01Hills/Lochs West of Drumbeg
page.content: This area to the west of Drumbeg comprises undulating hills and many inland lochs. The land is covered by heather and bracken, except for the many rocky outcrops and a few patches of deciduous bushes and small trees. The only habitation is in about ten cottages (including two newly completed)alongside the only road which runs east/west throughthe area. A green track runs south 1 1/2 miles from the road to old peat workings . There are good views from the hills.In the area across the lochs and hills to prominent features beyond, namely, the off-shore islands and open seas to the north, the mountains of Suilven and Canisp to the south and Quinag to the east. The only significant use of the land is for sheep grazing. the lochs are used by red and black-throated divers in the breeding season
